intro: Ligeophila jamesonii, commonly known as the Jameson's lichen, is a unique species of lichen that belongs to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its crustose growth form, forming a thin, flat layer on rock surfaces, typically in shaded, moist environments. The thallus is pale yellow to orange in color, with a distinct, granular texture. It is primarily found in temperate regions, often on limestone or sandstone substrates. This lichen is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role in soil formation and its sensitivity to environmental changes.
